comments.body: 1.2 is really old at this point, i would not even mention the change here

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +210,214 @@    ansible_ssh_pass
      The ssh password to use (this is insecure, we strongly recommend using --ask-pass or SSH keys)
    ansible_ssh_private_key_file
      Private key file used by ssh.  Useful if using multiple keys and you don't want to use SSH agent.

comments.body: we try to keep the intro light, so maybe just this link with a mention that other parameters exist might be a better change
If we remove ansible_su/do from there I don't see anywhere else where they are documented.
we can adde them to the become page under 'legacy'

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +214,218 @@
Privilege escalation (see :doc:`Ansible Privilege Escalation<become>` for further details)::

    ansible_become
      Equivalent to ansible_sudo or ansible_su, allows to force privilege escalation
